lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Noble patricians, patrons of my right,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Defend the justice of my cause with arms,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: And, countrymen, my loving followers,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Plead my successive title with your swords:
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: I am his first-born son, that was the last
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: That wore the imperial diadem of Rome;
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Then let my father's honours live in me,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Nor wrong mine age with this indignity.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: BASSIANUS
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Romans, friends, followers, favorers of my right,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: If ever Bassianus, Caesar's son,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Were gracious in the eyes of royal Rome,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Keep then this passage to the Capitol
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: And suffer not dishonour to approach
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: The imperial seat, to virtue consecrate,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: To justice, continence and nobility;
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: But let desert in pure election shine,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: And, Romans, fight for freedom in your choice.
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Princes, that strive by factions and by friends
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Ambitiously for rule and empery,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Know that the people of Rome, for whom we stand
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: A special party, have, by common voice,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: In election for the Roman empery,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Chosen Andronicus, surnamed Pius
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: For many good and great deserts to Rome:
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: A nobler man, a braver warrior,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Lives not this day within the city walls:
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: He by the senate is accit'd home
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: From weary wars against the barbarous Goths;
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: That, with his sons, a terror to our foes,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Hath yoked a nation strong, train'd up in arms.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Ten years are spent since first he undertook
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: This cause of Rome and chastised with arms
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Our enemies' pride: five times he hath return'd
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Bleeding to Rome, bearing his valiant sons
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: In coffins from the field;
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And now at last, laden with horror's spoils,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Returns the good Andronicus to Rome,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Renowned Titus, flourishing in arms.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Let us entreat, by honour of his name,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Whom worthily you would have now succeed.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And in the Capitol and senate's right,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Whom you pretend to honour and adore,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: That you withdraw you and abate your strength;
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Dismiss your followers and, as suitors should,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Plead your deserts in peace and humbleness.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: How fair the tribune speaks to calm my thoughts!
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: BASSIANUS
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Marcus Andronicus, so I do ally
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: In thy uprightness and integrity,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: And so I love and honour thee and thine,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Thy noble brother Titus and his sons,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: And her to whom my thoughts are humbled all,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Gracious Lavinia, Rome's rich ornament,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: That I will here dismiss my loving friends,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: And to my fortunes and the people's favor
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Commit my cause in balance to be weigh'd.
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Friends, that have been thus forward in my right,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: I thank you all and here dismiss you all,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: And to the love and favor of my country
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Commit myself, my person and the cause.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Rome, be as just and gracious unto me
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: As I am confident and kind to thee.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Open the gates, and let me in.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: BASSIANUS
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Tribunes, and me, a poor competitor.
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Captain
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: Romans, make way: the good Andronicus.
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: Patron of virtue, Rome's best champion,
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: Successful in the battles that he fights,
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: With honour and with fortune is return'd
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: From where he circumscribed with his sword,
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: And brought to yoke, the enemies of Rome.

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Hail, Rome, victorious in thy mourning weeds!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Lo, as the bark, that hath discharged her fraught,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Returns with precious jading to the bay
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: From whence at first she weigh'd her anchorage,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Cometh Andronicus, bound with laurel boughs,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: To re-salute his country with his tears,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Tears of true joy for his return to Rome.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Thou great defender of this Capitol,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Stand gracious to the rites that we intend!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Romans, of five and twenty valiant sons,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Half of the number that King Priam had,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Behold the poor remains, alive and dead!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: These that survive let Rome reward with love;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: These that I bring unto their latest home,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: With burial amongst their ancestors:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Here Goths have given me leave to sheathe my sword.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Titus, unkind and careless of thine own,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Why suffer'st thou thy sons, unburied yet,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: To hover on the dreadful shore of Styx?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Make way to lay them by their brethren.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: There greet in silence, as the dead are wont,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And sleep in peace, slain in your country's wars!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: O sacred receptacle of my joys,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Sweet cell of virtue and nobility,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: How many sons of mine hast thou in store,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: That thou wilt never render to me more!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Give us the proudest prisoner of the Goths,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: That we may hew his limbs, and on a pile
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Ad manes fratrum sacrifice his flesh,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Before this earthy prison of their bones;
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: That so the shadows be not unappeased,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Nor we disturb'd with prodigies on earth.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: I give him you, the noblest that survives,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: The eldest son of this distressed queen.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Stay, Roman brethren! Gracious conqueror,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Victorious Titus, rue the tears I shed,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: A mother's tears in passion for her son:
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: And if thy sons were ever dear to thee,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: O, think my son to be as dear to me!
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Sufficeth not that we are brought to Rome,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: To beautify thy triumphs and return,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Captive to thee and to thy Roman yoke,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: But must my sons be slaughter'd in the streets,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: For valiant doings in their country's cause?
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: O, if to fight for king and commonweal
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Were piety in thine, it is in these.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Andronicus, stain not thy tomb with blood:
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Wilt thou draw near the nature of the gods?
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Draw near them then in being merciful:
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Sweet mercy is nobility's true badge:
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Thrice noble Titus, spare my first-born son.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Patient yourself, madam, and pardon me.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: These are their brethren, whom you Goths beheld
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Alive and dead, and for their brethren slain
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Religiously they ask a sacrifice:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: To this your son is mark'd, and die he must,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: To appease their groaning shadows that are gone.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Away with him! and make a fire straight;
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: And with our swords, upon a pile of wood,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Let's hew his limbs till they be clean consumed.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: O cruel, irreligious piety!
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: CHIRON
lines.speaker: CHIRON

lines.value: Was ever Scythia half so barbarous?
lines.speaker: CHIRON

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Oppose not Scythia to ambitious Rome.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Alarbus goes to rest; and we survive
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: To tremble under Titus' threatening looks.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Then, madam, stand resolved, but hope withal
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: The self-same gods that arm'd the Queen of Troy
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: With opportunity of sharp revenge
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Upon the Thracian tyrant in his tent,
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: May favor Tamora, the Queen of Goths--
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: When Goths were Goths and Tamora was queen--
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: To quit the bloody wrongs upon her foes.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: See, lord and father, how we have perform'd
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Our Roman rites: Alarbus' limbs are lopp'd,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: And entrails feed the sacrificing fire,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Whose smoke, like incense, doth perfume the sky.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Remaineth nought, but to inter our brethren,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: And with loud 'larums welcome them to Rome.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Let it be so; and let Andronicus
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Make this his latest farewell to their souls.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: In peace and honour rest you here, my sons;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Rome's readiest champions, repose you here in rest,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Secure from worldly chances and mishaps!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Here lurks no treason, here no envy swells,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Here grow no damned grudges; here are no storms,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: No noise, but silence and eternal sleep:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: In peace and honour rest you here, my sons!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: LAVINIA
lines.speaker: LAVINIA

lines.value: In peace and honour live Lord Titus long;
lines.speaker: LAVINIA

lines.value: My noble lord and father, live in fame!
lines.speaker: LAVINIA

lines.value: Lo, at this tomb my tributary tears
lines.speaker: LAVINIA

lines.value: I render, for my brethren's obsequies;
lines.speaker: LAVINIA

lines.value: And at thy feet I kneel, with tears of joy,
lines.speaker: LAVINIA

lines.value: Shed on the earth, for thy return to Rome:
lines.speaker: LAVINIA

lines.value: O, bless me here with thy victorious hand,
lines.speaker: LAVINIA

lines.value: Whose fortunes Rome's best citizens applaud!
lines.speaker: LAVINIA

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Kind Rome, that hast thus lovingly reserved
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: The cordial of mine age to glad my heart!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Lavinia, live; outlive thy father's days,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And fame's eternal date, for virtue's praise!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Long live Lord Titus, my beloved brother,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Gracious triumpher in the eyes of Rome!
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Thanks, gentle tribune, noble brother Marcus.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And welcome, nephews, from successful wars,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: You that survive, and you that sleep in fame!
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Fair lords, your fortunes are alike in all,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: That in your country's service drew your swords:
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: But safer triumph is this funeral pomp,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: That hath aspired to Solon's happiness
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And triumphs over chance in honour's bed.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Titus Andronicus, the people of Rome,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Whose friend in justice thou hast ever been,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Send thee by me, their tribune and their trust,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: This palliament of white and spotless hue;
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And name thee in election for the empire,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: With these our late-deceased emperor's sons:
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Be candidatus then, and put it on,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And help to set a head on headless Rome.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: A better head her glorious body fits
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Than his that shakes for age and feebleness:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: What should I don this robe, and trouble you?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Be chosen with proclamations to-day,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: To-morrow yield up rule, resign my life,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And set abroad new business for you all?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Rome, I have been thy soldier forty years,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And led my country's strength successfully,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And buried one and twenty valiant sons,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Knighted in field, slain manfully in arms,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: In right and service of their noble country
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Give me a staff of honour for mine age,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: But not a sceptre to control the world:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Upright he held it, lords, that held it last.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Titus, thou shalt obtain and ask the empery.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Proud and ambitious tribune, canst thou tell?
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Patience, Prince Saturninus.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Romans, do me right:
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Patricians, draw your swords: and sheathe them not
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Till Saturninus be Rome's emperor.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Andronicus, would thou wert shipp'd to hell,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Rather than rob me of the people's hearts!
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Proud Saturnine, interrupter of the good
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: That noble-minded Titus means to thee!
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Content thee, prince; I will restore to thee
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: The people's hearts, and wean them from themselves.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: BASSIANUS
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Andronicus, I do not flatter thee,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: But honour thee, and will do till I die:
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: My faction if thou strengthen with thy friends,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: I will most thankful be; and thanks to men
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Of noble minds is honourable meed.
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: People of Rome, and people's tribunes here,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: I ask your voices and your suffrages:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Will you bestow them friendly on Andronicus?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Tribunes
lines.speaker: Tribunes

lines.value: To gratify the good Andronicus,
lines.speaker: Tribunes

lines.value: And gratulate his safe return to Rome,
lines.speaker: Tribunes

lines.value: The people will accept whom he admits.
lines.speaker: Tribunes

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Tribunes, I thank you: and this suit I make,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: That you create your emperor's eldest son,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Lord Saturnine; whose virtues will, I hope,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Reflect on Rome as Titan's rays on earth,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And ripen justice in this commonweal:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Then, if you will elect by my advice,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Crown him and say 'Long live our emperor!'
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: With voices and applause of every sort,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Patricians and plebeians, we create
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Lord Saturninus Rome's great emperor,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And say 'Long live our Emperor Saturnine!'
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Titus Andronicus, for thy favors done
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: To us in our election this day,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: I give thee thanks in part of thy deserts,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: And will with deeds requite thy gentleness:
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: And, for an onset, Titus, to advance
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Thy name and honourable family,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Lavinia will I make my empress,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Rome's royal mistress, mistress of my heart,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: And in the sacred Pantheon her espouse:
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Tell me, Andronicus, doth this motion please thee?
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: It doth, my worthy lord; and in this match
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: I hold me highly honour'd of your grace:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And here in sight of Rome to Saturnine,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: King and commander of our commonweal,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: The wide world's emperor, do I consecrate
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: My sword, my chariot and my prisoners;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Presents well worthy Rome's imperial lord:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Receive them then, the tribute that I owe,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Mine honour's ensigns humbled at thy feet.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Thanks, noble Titus, father of my life!
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: How proud I am of thee and of thy gifts

lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: The least of these unspeakable deserts,

lines.value: an emperor;

lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: A goodly lady, trust me; of the hue

lines.value: That I would choose, were I to choose anew.

lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Can make you greater than the Queen of Goths.

lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: LAVINIA
lines.speaker: LAVINIA

lines.value: Not I, my lord; sith true nobility
lines.speaker: LAVINIA

lines.value: Warrants these words in princely courtesy.
lines.speaker: LAVINIA

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: BASSIANUS
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: BASSIANUS
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Ay, noble Titus; and resolved withal
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: To do myself this reason and this right.
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Surprised! by whom?

lines.value: BASSIANUS
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: MUTIUS

lines.value: And with my sword I'll keep this door safe.
lines.speaker: MUTIUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: MUTIUS

lines.value: My lord, you pass not here.
lines.speaker: MUTIUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: What, villain boy!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Barr'st me my way in Rome?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: MUTIUS
lines.speaker: MUTIUS

lines.value: Help, Lucius, help!
lines.speaker: MUTIUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: My lord, you are unjust, and, more than so,

lines.value: In wrongful quarrel you have slain your son.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Nor thou, nor he, are any sons of mine;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: My sons would never so dishonour me:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Dead, if you will; but not to be his wife,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: That is another's lawful promised love.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: No, Titus, no; the emperor needs her not,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Nor her, nor thee, nor any of thy stock:

lines.value: I'll trust, by leisure, him that mocks me once;
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Thee never, nor thy traitorous haughty sons,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Confederates all thus to dishonour me.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Was there none else in Rome to make a stale,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: But Saturnine? Full well, Andronicus,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Agree these deeds with that proud brag of thine,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: That said'st I begg'd the empire at thy hands.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: O monstrous! what reproachful words are these?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: But go thy ways; go, give that changing piece
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: To him that flourish'd for her with his sword
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: A valiant son-in-law thou shalt enjoy;
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: One fit to bandy with thy lawless sons,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: To ruffle in the commonwealth of Rome.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: These words are razors to my wounded heart.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: And therefore, lovely Tamora, queen of Goths,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: That like the stately Phoebe 'mongst her nymphs
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Dost overshine the gallant'st dames of Rome,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: If thou be pleased with this my sudden choice,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: And will create thee empress of Rome,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Speak, Queen of Goths, dost thou applaud my choice?
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: And here I swear by all the Roman gods,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Sith priest and holy water are so near
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: And tapers burn so bright and every thing
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: In readiness for Hymenaeus stand,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: I will not re-salute the streets of Rome,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Or climb my palace, till from forth this place
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: I lead espoused my bride along with me.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: And here, in sight of heaven, to Rome I swear,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: If Saturnine advance the Queen of Goths,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: She will a handmaid be to his desires,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: A loving nurse, a mother to his youth.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Ascend, fair queen, Pantheon. Lords, accompany
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Your noble emperor and his lovely bride,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Sent by the heavens for Prince Saturnine,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Whose wisdom hath her fortune conquered:
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: There shall we consummate our spousal rites.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: I am not bid to wait upon this bride.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Titus, when wert thou wont to walk alone,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Dishonour'd thus, and challenged of wrongs?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: O Titus, see, O, see what thou hast done!
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: In a bad quarrel slain a virtuous son.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: No, foolish tribune, no; no son of mine,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Nor thou, nor these, confederates in the deed
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: That hath dishonour'd all our family;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Unworthy brother, and unworthy sons!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: But let us give him burial, as becomes;
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Give Mutius burial with our brethren.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Traitors, away! he rests not in this tomb:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: This monument five hundred years hath stood,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Which I have sumptuously re-edified:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Here none but soldiers and Rome's servitors
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Repose in fame; none basely slain in brawls:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Bury him where you can; he comes not here.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: My lord, this is impiety in you:
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: My nephew Mutius' deeds do plead for him
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: He must be buried with his brethren.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: QUINTUS
lines.speaker: QUINTUS

lines.value: MARTIUS
lines.speaker: MARTIUS

lines.value: And shall, or him we will accompany.
lines.speaker: MARTIUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: 'And shall!' what villain was it that spake
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: that word?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: QUINTUS
lines.speaker: QUINTUS

lines.value: He that would vouch it in any place but here.
lines.speaker: QUINTUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: What, would you bury him in my despite?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: No, noble Titus, but entreat of thee
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: To pardon Mutius and to bury him.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Marcus, even thou hast struck upon my crest,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And, with these boys, mine honour thou hast wounded:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: My foes I do repute you every one;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: So, trouble me no more, but get you gone.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: MARTIUS
lines.speaker: MARTIUS

lines.value: He is not with himself; let us withdraw.
lines.speaker: MARTIUS

lines.value: QUINTUS
lines.speaker: QUINTUS

lines.value: Not I, till Mutius' bones be buried.
lines.speaker: QUINTUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Brother, for in that name doth nature plead,--
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: QUINTUS
lines.speaker: QUINTUS

lines.value: Father, and in that name doth nature speak,--
lines.speaker: QUINTUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Speak thou no more, if all the rest will speed.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Renowned Titus, more than half my soul,--
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Dear father, soul and substance of us all,--
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Suffer thy brother Marcus to inter
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: His noble nephew here in virtue's nest,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: That died in honour and Lavinia's cause.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Thou art a Roman; be not barbarous:
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: That slew himself; and wise Laertes' son
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Did graciously plead for his funerals:
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Let not young Mutius, then, that was thy joy
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Be barr'd his entrance here.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Rise, Marcus, rise.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: The dismall'st day is this that e'er I saw,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: To be dishonour'd by my sons in Rome!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Well, bury him, and bury me the next.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: There lie thy bones, sweet Mutius, with thy friends,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Till we with trophies do adorn thy tomb.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: All
lines.speaker: All

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: My lord, to step out of these dreary dumps,

lines.value: Is of a sudden thus advanced in Rome?
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: I know not, Marcus; but I know it is,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Is she not then beholding to the man
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: That brought her for this high good turn so far?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Yes, and will nobly him remunerate.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: So, Bassianus, you have play'd your prize:

lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: BASSIANUS
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: And you of yours, my lord! I say no more,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Nor wish no less; and so, I take my leave.
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Traitor, if Rome have law or we have power,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Thou and thy faction shall repent this rape.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: BASSIANUS
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Rape, call you it, my lord, to seize my own,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: My truth-betrothed love and now my wife?
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: But let the laws of Rome determine all;
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Meanwhile I am possess'd of that is mine.
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: 'Tis good, sir: you are very short with us;
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: But, if we live, we'll be as sharp with you.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: BASSIANUS
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: My lord, what I have done, as best I may,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Answer I must and shall do with my life.
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Only thus much I give your grace to know:
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: By all the duties that I owe to Rome,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: This noble gentleman, Lord Titus here,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Is in opinion and in honour wrong'd;
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: That in the rescue of Lavinia
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: With his own hand did slay his youngest son,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: In zeal to you and highly moved to wrath
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: To be controll'd in that he frankly gave:
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: Receive him, then, to favor, Saturnine,
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: That hath express'd himself in all his deeds
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: A father and a friend to thee and Rome.
lines.speaker: BASSIANUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Prince Bassianus, leave to plead my deeds:

lines.value: 'Tis thou and those that have dishonour'd me.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Rome and the righteous heavens be my judge,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: How I have loved and honour'd Saturnine!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: My worthy lord, if ever Tamora
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Were gracious in those princely eyes of thine,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Then hear me speak in indifferently for all;
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: And at my suit, sweet, pardon what is past.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: What, madam! be dishonour'd openly,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: And basely put it up without revenge?
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Not so, my lord; the gods of Rome forfend
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: I should be author to dishonour you!
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: But on mine honour dare I undertake
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: For good Lord Titus' innocence in all;
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Whose fury not dissembled speaks his griefs:
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Then, at my suit, look graciously on him;
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Lose not so noble a friend on vain suppose,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Nor with sour looks afflict his gentle heart.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: be won at last;
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Dissemble all your griefs and discontents:

lines.value: You are but newly planted in your throne;
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Lest, then, the people, and patricians too,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Upon a just survey, take Titus' part,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: And so supplant you for ingratitude,

lines.value: Which Rome reputes to be a heinous sin,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: And raze their faction and their family,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: The cruel father and his traitorous sons,

lines.value: And make them know what 'tis to let a queen

lines.value: Take up this good old man, and cheer the heart

lines.value: SATURNINUS

lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
