lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: I will dismount, and by the waggon-wheel
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Trot, like a servile footman, all day long,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Even from Hyperion's rising in the east
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Until his very downfall in the sea:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And day by day I'll do this heavy task,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: So thou destroy Rapine and Murder there.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: These are my ministers, and come with me.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Are these thy ministers? what are they call'd?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Rapine and Murder; therefore called so,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Cause they take vengeance of such kind of men.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Good Lord, how like the empress' sons they are!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And you, the empress! but we worldly men
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Have miserable, mad, mistaking eyes.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: O sweet Revenge, now do I come to thee;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And, if one arm's embracement will content thee,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: I will embrace thee in it by and by.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: This closing with him fits his lunacy
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Whate'er I forge to feed his brain-sick fits,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Do you uphold and maintain in your speeches,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: For now he firmly takes me for Revenge;
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: And, being credulous in this mad thought,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: I'll make him send for Lucius his son;
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: And, whilst I at a banquet hold him sure,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: I'll find some cunning practise out of hand,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: To scatter and disperse the giddy Goths,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Or, at the least, make them his enemies.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: See, here he comes, and I must ply my theme.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Long have I been forlorn, and all for thee:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Welcome, dread Fury, to my woful house:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Rapine and Murder, you are welcome too.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: How like the empress and her sons you are!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Well are you fitted, had you but a Moor:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Could not all hell afford you such a devil?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: For well I wot the empress never wags
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: But in her company there is a Moor;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And, would you represent our queen aright,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: It were convenient you had such a devil:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: But welcome, as you are. What shall we do?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: What wouldst thou have us do, Andronicus?
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Show me a murderer, I'll deal with him.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: CHIRON
lines.speaker: CHIRON

lines.value: Show me a villain that hath done a rape,
lines.speaker: CHIRON

lines.value: And I am sent to be revenged on him.
lines.speaker: CHIRON

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Show me a thousand that have done thee wrong,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: And I will be revenged on them all.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Look round about the wicked streets of Rome;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And when thou find'st a man that's like thyself.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Good Murder, stab him; he's a murderer.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Go thou with him; and when it is thy hap
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: To find another that is like to thee,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Good Rapine, stab him; he's a ravisher.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Go thou with them; and in the emperor's court
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: There is a queen, attended by a Moor;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Well mayst thou know her by thy own proportion,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: for up and down she doth resemble thee:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: I pray thee, do on them some violent death;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: They have been violent to me and mine.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Well hast thou lesson'd us; this shall we do.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: But would it please thee, good Andronicus,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: To send for Lucius, thy thrice-valiant son,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Who leads towards Rome a band of warlike Goths,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: And bid him come and banquet at thy house;
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: When he is here, even at thy solemn feast,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: I will bring in the empress and her sons,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: The emperor himself and all thy foes;
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: And at thy mercy shalt they stoop and kneel,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: And on them shalt thou ease thy angry heart.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: What says Andronicus to this device?
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Marcus, my brother! 'tis sad Titus calls.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Go, gentle Marcus, to thy nephew Lucius;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Thou shalt inquire him out among the Goths:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Bid him repair to me, and bring with him
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Some of the chiefest princes of the Goths;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Bid him encamp his soldiers where they are:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Tell him the emperor and the empress too
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Feast at my house, and he shall feast with them.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: This do thou for my love; and so let him,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: As he regards his aged father's life.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: This will I do, and soon return again.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Now will I hence about thy business,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: And take my ministers along with me.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Nay, nay, let Rape and Murder stay with me;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Or else I'll call my brother back again,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And cleave to no revenge but Lucius.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: [Aside to her sons]  What say you, boys? will you
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: bide with him,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Whiles I go tell my lord the emperor
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: How I have govern'd our determined jest?
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Yield to his humour, smooth and speak him fair,
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: And tarry with him till I turn again.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: [Aside]  I know them all, though they suppose me mad,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And will o'erreach them in their own devices:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: A pair of cursed hell-hounds and their dam!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: DEMETRIUS
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: Madam, depart at pleasure; leave us here.
lines.speaker: DEMETRIUS

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Farewell, Andronicus: Revenge now goes
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: To lay a complot to betray thy foes.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: I know thou dost; and, sweet Revenge, farewell.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: CHIRON
lines.speaker: CHIRON

lines.value: Tell us, old man, how shall we be employ'd?
lines.speaker: CHIRON

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Tut, I have work enough for you to do.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Publius, come hither, Caius, and Valentine!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: PUBLIUS
lines.speaker: PUBLIUS

lines.value: What is your will?
lines.speaker: PUBLIUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Know you these two?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: PUBLIUS
lines.speaker: PUBLIUS

lines.value: The empress' sons, I take them, Chiron and Demetrius.
lines.speaker: PUBLIUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Fie, Publius, fie! thou art too much deceived;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: The one is Murder, Rape is the other's name;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And therefore bind them, gentle Publius.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Caius and Valentine, lay hands on them.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Oft have you heard me wish for such an hour,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And now I find it; therefore bind them sure,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And stop their mouths, if they begin to cry.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: CHIRON
lines.speaker: CHIRON

lines.value: Villains, forbear! we are the empress' sons.
lines.speaker: CHIRON

lines.value: PUBLIUS
lines.speaker: PUBLIUS

lines.value: And therefore do we what we are commanded.
lines.speaker: PUBLIUS

lines.value: Stop close their mouths, let them not speak a word.
lines.speaker: PUBLIUS

lines.value: Is he sure bound? look that you bind them fast.
lines.speaker: PUBLIUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Come, come, Lavinia; look, thy foes are bound.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Sirs, stop their mouths, let them not speak to me;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: But let them hear what fearful words I utter.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: O villains, Chiron and Demetrius!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Here stands the spring whom you have stain'd with mud,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: This goodly summer with your winter mix'd.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: You kill'd her husband, and for that vile fault
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Two of her brothers were condemn'd to death,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: My hand cut off and made a merry jest;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Both her sweet hands, her tongue, and that more dear
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Than hands or tongue, her spotless chastity,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Inhuman traitors, you constrain'd and forced.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: What would you say, if I should let you speak?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Villains, for shame you could not beg for grace.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Hark, wretches! how I mean to martyr you.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: This one hand yet is left to cut your throats,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Whilst that Lavinia 'tween her stumps doth hold
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: The basin that receives your guilty blood.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: You know your mother means to feast with me,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And calls herself Revenge, and thinks me mad:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Hark, villains! I will grind your bones to dust
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And with your blood and it I'll make a paste,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And of the paste a coffin I will rear
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And make two pasties of your shameful heads,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And bid that strumpet, your unhallow'd dam,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Like to the earth swallow her own increase.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: This is the feast that I have bid her to,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And this the banquet she shall surfeit on;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: For worse than Philomel you used my daughter,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And worse than Progne I will be revenged:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And now prepare your throats. Lavinia, come,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Receive the blood: and when that they are dead,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Let me go grind their bones to powder small
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And with this hateful liquor temper it;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And in that paste let their vile heads be baked.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Come, come, be every one officious
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: To make this banquet; which I wish may prove
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: More stern and bloody than the Centaurs' feast.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: So, now bring them in, for I'll play the cook,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And see them ready 'gainst their mother comes.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Uncle Marcus, since it is my father's mind
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: That I repair to Rome, I am content.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: First Goth
lines.speaker: First Goth

lines.value: And ours with thine, befall what fortune will.
lines.speaker: First Goth

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Good uncle, take you in this barbarous Moor,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: This ravenous tiger, this accursed devil;
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Let him receive no sustenance, fetter him
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Till he be brought unto the empress' face,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: For testimony of her foul proceedings:
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: And see the ambush of our friends be strong;
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: I fear the emperor means no good to us.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: AARON
lines.speaker: AARON

lines.value: Some devil whisper curses in mine ear,
lines.speaker: AARON

lines.value: And prompt me, that my tongue may utter forth
lines.speaker: AARON

lines.value: The venomous malice of my swelling heart!
lines.speaker: AARON

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Away, inhuman dog! unhallow'd slave!
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Sirs, help our uncle to convey him in.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: The trumpets show the emperor is at hand.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: What, hath the firmament more suns than one?
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: What boots it thee to call thyself a sun?
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Rome's emperor, and nephew, break the parle;
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: These quarrels must be quietly debated.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: The feast is ready, which the careful Titus
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Hath ordain'd to an honourable end,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: For peace, for love, for league, and good to Rome:
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Please you, therefore, draw nigh, and take your places.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Marcus, we will.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Welcome, my gracious lord; welcome, dread queen;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Welcome, ye warlike Goths; welcome, Lucius;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And welcome, all: although the cheer be poor,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: 'Twill fill your stomachs; please you eat of it.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Why art thou thus attired, Andronicus?
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Because I would be sure to have all well,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: To entertain your highness and your empress.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: We are beholding to you, good Andronicus.
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: An if your highness knew my heart, you were.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: My lord the emperor, resolve me this:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Was it well done of rash Virginius
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: To slay his daughter with his own right hand,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Because she was enforced, stain'd, and deflower'd?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: It was, Andronicus.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Your reason, mighty lord?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Because the girl should not survive her shame,
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: And by her presence still renew his sorrows.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: A reason mighty, strong, and effectual;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: A pattern, precedent, and lively warrant,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: For me, most wretched, to perform the like.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Die, die, Lavinia, and thy shame with thee;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And, with thy shame, thy father's sorrow die!
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: What hast thou done, unnatural and unkind?
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Kill'd her, for whom my tears have made me blind.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: I am as woful as Virginius was,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And have a thousand times more cause than he
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: To do this outrage: and it now is done.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: What, was she ravish'd? tell who did the deed.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Will't please you eat? will't please your
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: highness feed?
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: TAMORA
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: Why hast thou slain thine only daughter thus?
lines.speaker: TAMORA

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Not I; 'twas Chiron and Demetrius:
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: They ravish'd her, and cut away her tongue;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And they, 'twas they, that did her all this wrong.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Go fetch them hither to us presently.
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: TITUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Why, there they are both, baked in that pie;
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Whereof their mother daintily hath fed,
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Eating the flesh that she herself hath bred.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: 'Tis true, 'tis true; witness my knife's sharp point.
lines.speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: SATURNINUS
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: Die, frantic wretch, for this accursed deed!
lines.speaker: SATURNINUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Can the son's eye behold his father bleed?
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: There's meed for meed, death for a deadly deed!
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: You sad-faced men, people and sons of Rome,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: By uproar sever'd, like a flight of fowl
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Scatter'd by winds and high tempestuous gusts,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: O, let me teach you how to knit again
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: This scatter'd corn  into one mutual sheaf,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: These broken limbs again into one body;
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Lest Rome herself be bane unto herself,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And she whom mighty kingdoms court'sy to,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Like a forlorn and desperate castaway,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Do shameful execution on herself.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: But if my frosty signs and chaps of age,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Grave witnesses of true experience,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Cannot induce you to attend my words,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Speak, Rome's dear friend, as erst our ancestor,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: When with his solemn tongue he did discourse
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: To love-sick Dido's sad attending ear
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: The story of that baleful burning night
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: When subtle Greeks surprised King Priam's Troy,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Tell us what Sinon hath bewitch'd our ears,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Or who hath brought the fatal engine in
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: That gives our Troy, our Rome, the civil wound.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: My heart is not compact of flint nor steel;
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Nor can I utter all our bitter grief,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: But floods of tears will drown my oratory,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And break my utterance, even in the time
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: When it should move you to attend me most,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Lending your kind commiseration.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Here is a captain, let him tell the tale;
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Your hearts will throb and weep to hear him speak.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Then, noble auditory, be it known to you,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: That cursed Chiron and Demetrius
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Were they that murdered our emperor's brother;
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: And they it were that ravished our sister:
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: For their fell faults our brothers were beheaded;
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Our father's tears despised, and basely cozen'd
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Of that true hand that fought Rome's quarrel out,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: And sent her enemies unto the grave.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Lastly, myself unkindly banished,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: The gates shut on me, and turn'd weeping out,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: To beg relief among Rome's enemies:
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Who drown'd their enmity in my true tears.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: And oped their arms to embrace me as a friend.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: I am the turned forth, be it known to you,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: That have preserved her welfare in my blood;
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: And from her bosom took the enemy's point,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Sheathing the steel in my adventurous body.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Alas, you know I am no vaunter, I;
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: My scars can witness, dumb although they are,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: That my report is just and full of truth.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: But, soft! methinks I do digress too much,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Citing my worthless praise: O, pardon me;
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: For when no friends are by, men praise themselves.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Now is my turn to speak. Behold this child:
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Of this was Tamora delivered;
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: The issue of an irreligious Moor,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Chief architect and plotter of these woes:
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: The villain is alive in Titus' house,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And as he is, to witness this is true.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Now judge what cause had Titus to revenge
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: These wrongs, unspeakable, past patience,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Or more than any living man could bear.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Now you have heard the truth, what say you, Romans?
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Have we done aught amiss,--show us wherein,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And, from the place where you behold us now,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: The poor remainder of Andronici
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Will, hand in hand, all headlong cast us down.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And on the ragged stones beat forth our brains,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: And make a mutual closure of our house.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Speak, Romans, speak; and if you say we shall,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Lo, hand in hand, Lucius and I will fall.
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: To heal Rome's harms, and wipe away her woe!
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: These sorrowful drops upon thy blood-stain'd face,
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: The last true duties of thy noble son!

lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Tear for tear, and loving kiss for kiss,
lines.speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS

lines.value: Thy brother Marcus tenders on thy lips:

lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.speaker: LUCIUS
